chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
p: nat
Hp: p <> 0

Goal:
forall x y z : Z_Zp, x ⊗ (y ⊗ z) = x ⊗ y ⊗ z

Premises:
Z_Zp = {x : nat | x < p} : Set
Zp_mult_comm : forall x y, x ⊗ y = y ⊗ x
Zp_plus_assoc : forall x y z : Z_Zp, x ⊕ (y ⊕ z) = x ⊕ y ⊕ z
Zp_mult_one : forall x, Op ⊗ x = x
Zp_mult_one_r : forall x, x ⊗ Op = x
Nat.divide = fun x y : nat => exists z : nat, y = z * x : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments Nat.divide (_ _)%nat_scope
cmp_sub : forall x y : nat, {z : nat | z + y = x} + {x < y}
BinPosDef.Pos.sub = fun x y : positive => match BinPosDef.Pos.sub_mask x y with | BinPosDef.Pos.IsPos z => z | _ => 1%positive end : positive -> positive -> positive Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.sub (_ _)%positive_scope
Nat.divmod_spec : forall x y q u : nat, u <= y -> let (q', u') := Nat.divmod x y q u in x + S y * q + (y - u) = S y * q' + (y - u') /\ u' <= y
inj_eq : forall x y : nat, x = y -> Z.of_nat x = Z.of_nat y
Nat.div_mod : forall x y : nat, y <> 0 -> x = y * (x / y) + x mod y
Zp_plus_comm : forall x y, x ⊕ y = y ⊕ x
Zp_inj : forall x y, proj1_sig x = proj1_sig y -> x = y
measure_rect : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> nat) (P : X -> Type), (forall x : X, (forall y : X, m y < m x -> P y) -> P x) -> forall x : X, P x
BinPosDef.Pos.mul = fix mul (x y : positive) {struct x} : positive := match x with | (p~1)%positive => (y + (mul p y)~0)%positive | (p~0)%positive => ((mul p y)~0)%positive | 1%positive => y end : positive -> positive -> positive Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.mul (_ _)%positive_scope
lt_pirr : forall (x y : nat) (H1 H2 : x < y), H1 = H2
Init.Nat.div = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => fst (Init.Nat.divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.div (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.modulo = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => y' - snd (Init.Nat.divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.modulo (_ _)%nat_scope

Z.le = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y)%Z <> Gt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.add = fun x y : Z => match x with | 0%Z => y | Z.pos x' => match y with | 0%Z => x | Z.pos y' => Z.pos (x' + y') | Z.neg y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub x' y' end | Z.neg x' => match y with | 0%Z => x | Z.pos y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub y' x' | Z.neg y' => Z.neg (x' + y') end end : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.add (_ _)%Z_scope
Zp_plus_zero : forall x, Zp ⊕ x = x
Nat.gcd_wd = fun (x x' : nat) (Hx : x = x') (y y' : nat) (Hy : y = y') => Nat.gcd_unique x y (Nat.gcd x' y') (Nat.gcd_nonneg x' y') ((fun lemma : x = x' => Morphisms.Reflexive_partial_app_morphism (Morphisms.subrelation_proper Nat.divide_wd tt (Morphisms.subrelation_respectful (Morphisms.subrelation_refl eq) (Morphisms.subrelation_respectful (Morphisms.subrelation_refl eq) Morphisms.iff_flip_impl_subrelation))) (Morphisms.reflexive_proper_proxy RelationClasses.Equivalence_Reflexive (Nat.gcd x' y')) x x' lemma) Hx (Nat.gcd_divide_l x' y')) ((fun lemma : y = y' => Morphisms.Reflexive_partial_app_morphism (Morphisms.subrelation_proper Nat.divide_wd tt (Morphisms.subrelation_respectful (Morphisms.sub...
Z.lt = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y)%Z = Lt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
Zp_minus : forall x, x ⊕ ∸ x = Zp
BinPosDef.Pos.add = with add (x y : positive) {struct x} : positive := match x with | (p~1)%positive => match y with | (q~1)%positive => ((add_carry p q)~0)%positive | (q~0)%positive => ((add p q)~1)%positive | 1%positive => ((BinPosDef.Pos.succ p)~0)%positive end | (p~0)%positive => match y with | (q~1)%positive => ((add p q)~1)%positive | (q~0)%positive => ((add p q)~0)%positive | 1%positive => (p~1)%positive end | 1%positive => match y with | (q~1)%positive => ((BinPosDef.Pos.succ q)~0)%positive | (q~0)%positive => (q~1)%positive | 1%positive => 2%positive end end with add_carry (x y : positive) {struct x} : positive := match x with...
Init.Nat.divmod = fix divmod (x y q u : nat) {struct x} : nat * nat := match x with | 0 => (q, u) | S x' => match u with | 0 => divmod x' y (S q) y | S u' => divmod x' y q u' end end : nat -> nat -> nat -> nat -> nat * nat Arguments Init.Nat.divmod (_ _ _ _)%nat_scope
Nat.even_wd = fun (x x' : nat) (EQ : x = x') => (fun lemma : Nat.even x = Nat.even x' <-> (Nat.even x = true <-> Nat.even x' = true) => Morphisms.iff_flip_impl_subrelation (Nat.even x = Nat.even x') (Nat.even x = true <-> Nat.even x' = true) lemma) (Bool.eq_iff_eq_true (Nat.even x) (Nat.even x')) ((fun lemma : Nat.even x = true <-> Nat.Even x => Morphisms.trans_co_eq_inv_impl_morphism RelationClasses.iff_Transitive (Nat.even x = true) (Nat.Even x) lemma (Nat.even x' = true) (Nat.even x' = true) (Morphisms.eq_proper_proxy (Nat.even x' = true))) (Nat.even_spec x) ((fun lemma : Nat.even x' = true <-> Nat.Even x' => Morphisms.trans_sym_co_inv_impl_morphism (Relation...
BinIntDef.Z.mul = fun x y : Z => match x with | 0%Z => 0%Z | Z.pos x' => match y with | 0%Z => 0%Z | Z.pos y' => Z.pos (x' * y') | Z.neg y' => Z.neg (x' * y') end | Z.neg x' => match y with | 0%Z => 0%Z | Z.pos y' => Z.neg (x' * y') | Z.neg y' => Z.pos (x' * y') end end : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.mul (_ _)%Z_scope
Zp_one = exist (fun x : nat => x < p) (rem 1 p) (div_rem_spec2 1 Hp) : Z_Zp
BinPosDef.Pos.to_nat = fun x : positive => BinPosDef.Pos.iter_op Init.Nat.add x 1 : positive -> nat Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.to_nat _%positive_scope : simpl never
